intro: Pterichis barbifrons, commonly known as the hairy pterichis, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and prairies, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster. Pterichis barbifrons is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
